result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla J Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 12 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs must be paid within the first year of probation.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns, except for the purposes of employment.
Expungement granted under 973.015 upon successful completion of probation.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kayla J Wilson

records.addlTxt: from DOC that DE failed to meet conditions for expungement

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kayla J Wilson in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:10 PM. State - resolved - amend count #1 to possession of scheduled I/II narcotic drug contrary to 961.41(3g)(am) - class I felony - plead G, count #4 and #5 will be DRI, withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 1 year conditional jail with defense free to argue, AODA, anger management and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, employment/school, no contact with Breanna Wilson. Finlan agrees and directs Court to a letter attached to plea questionnaire in regards to the anger management and the condition of no entry into any bar or tavern as she works at a bar. Wilson agrees. Court dismisses and reads in counts #4 and #5 (#2 & #3) and amends count #1 to possession of schedule I/II narcotic contrary to 961.41(3g)(am) - reads new charge and penalty. Wilson pleads G to amended count #1. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - asks for 1 year of conditional jail for stated reasons - otherwise follow joint recommendation. Finlan makes final argument prior to sentencing - requests no jail time for stated reasons - otherwise follow joint recommendation - asks for expunction under 973.015 - credit for 12 days only if revoked - if Court orders jail, would ask for time to report and huber. Wilson makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns except for employment purposes, costs - paid thru probation and to be paid within the first year, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 60 days in FC jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - report by 8:30 AM on 3/25/16 - credit for 12 days only if revoked, submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, expungement granted under 973.015 upon successful completion of probation, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Kayla J Wilson in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:35 PM. Also called companion case, 15CF178 (State vs. Beverly Bartlett - who appears in person and with her counsel Mary Burns). State calls Breanna Wilson. Wilson sworn in at 2:36 PM. Court makes statement regarding use immunity for today and 5th amendment rights. Scholke has gone over 5th amendment rights with the witness and State agrees that she is granted use immunity today. Court goes thru 5th amendment and use immunity collaquey with the witness. Witness understands those rights. Counsel has nothing further to add to rights/collaquey. Direct exam by State at 2:38 PM. Burns objects - speculation - sustained (2:46 PM). Finlan stipulates to identification of his client for today's purposes (2:48 PM). Burns stipulates to identification of her client for today's purposes (2:50 PM). Burns objects - speculation - overruled (2:50 PM). Cross exam by Burns at 2:50 PM. State objects - sustained (2:52 PM). State objects - form of question - sustained (2:52 PM). No cross by Finlan. Wilson excused at 2:53 PM. State calls Sgt. Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 2:54 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Burns at 3:04 PM. No cross by Finlan. Robinson excused. Burns makes statement regarding the return of items held at the jail. Finlan has nothing further. Court finds probable cause on each case, binds both defendants over for trial. State files Informations on both cases that mirrors complaints. Burns files Motion for Substitution of Judge. Court denies for stated reasons (consolidated case). Burns and Finlan have Informations, Burns and Finlan waive reading of it, Burns enters NG pleas on all counts for her client and Finlan enters NG pleas to all counts for his client. Court accepts NG pleas for both cases, continues bond for both cases, sets both cases for FPT. Burns makes comment regarding civil action filed against her client by State for civil forfeiture (15CV85). State and Court respond. State is lenient on time to file answer on civil matter. Burns and Finlan ask about personal items being held by FOSO to be released. State will confirm with FOSO regarding these items. State will make a decision on the phone within 10 days, other items can be returned to the owners. Finlan and Burns can make arrangements with the deputies for pick-up of states items. State - will be retaining the narcotics that have been seized. Court - FOSO to release Ms. Barlett's driver's license. Burns asks if the narcotics that are not part of the crime can be released to the defendant. State responds - needs claritication from her physician for stated reasons. Court - defendant needs to get something from the doctor for the return of the narcotics. Burns requesting FOSO to do an inventory of the pills being held. State and Court respond. Adjourned at 3:22 PM.

ADDRESS INFO for Kayla J Wilson
Current: 5680 Old 8 Rd, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 11-19-2015)
Prior: 3000 Mitchell Plat Rd, Hiles, WI 54541
No consumption of alcohol and no contact with Breanna Wilson.

Defendant Kayla J Wilson in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:09 AM. Finlan has complaint, has gone over it with the defendant, waives reading, understands charges. Court sets for PH and continues bond. State would like a no contact provision with Breanna Wilson. Finlan - no objections. Court modifies bond to include that condition.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
